p: In Brazil, fighting the vector during the transmission periods is sought or achieved through the elimination of potential breeding sites and the application of larvicide in water containers, as well as the use of insecticide for the adult forms [ 10]. The Ministry of Health in Brazil recommends the indiscriminate removal of containers which have the potential for the reproduction of Aedes aegypti, no matter their type or size. However, the feasibility of some small sites to produce adult forms of the vector has not actually been well established. This information is essential for designing a more efficient and cost-effective removal program.
